result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

(Case called at 1:46 PM) Defendant Marcel D. Wiseman in court, in custody with Attorney Andrew T Knaak.  Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss Count 6 of Information. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. State does not object to Defendant's Motion. Court grants motion and dismisses Count 6. State will file and an amended information without Count 6. 
Defendant enters Not Guilty pleas on Counts 1-5. Court receives Not Guilty pleas on Counts 1-5. 
Discussion held regarding scheduling. Defendant's address is updated.

3:16 PM Defendant Marcel D. Wiseman in court, in custody.  Attorney Andrew T Knaak in court for Marcel D. Wiseman.  Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for State of Wisconsin. This is the date and time set for a preliminary hearing. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. The parties are ready to proceed. 
State requests a transactional finding based on the letter previously filed by the State. The Court hold decision until the end of the hearing.

State calls Officer Timothy Peterson, Altoona Police Department to the stand; sworn and testifies. Witness identifies the defendant and the record will so reflect. Cross examination by Defense. Witness steps down.

State requests bind over. Defense makes brief argument.

Court finds matters are transactional related and finds probable cause and binds the matter over to Br. 4 for further scheduling.
Dated 09/27/2022, Letter from ADA Winter to Court regarding transactional relationship of counts and preliminary hearing.

11:54 AM Defendant Marcel D. Wiseman appeared by video, in custody from the Eau Claire County Jail.  Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Rachel Robole appeared with Defendant. 

This court date set to see if Defendant could secure a stable residence. Defendant has not established stable housing.

State reiterates the need for the current bond. 

Court does not modify bond, it remains as a $25.000 cash bond.

Judge Jon Theisen for Branch 2 intake. 
(Case called at 11:07 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Marcel Wiseman appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Sonia Anderson. ADA Afton Lewis appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint. State requests $25,000 cash bond. Defense requests signature bond. Court has discussion with Defendant regarding providing an updated address/work history and setting a Bail Bond Hearing. 
Court orders $25,000 cash bond with various conditions. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. 
Bail Bond Hearing: 07/29/2022 at 11:30 AM (intake).

Conditions:
No contact with L.S., L.S.'s school, L.S.'s residence.
No contact with A.W., A.W.'s children, A.W.'s residence.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services.
No unsupervised contact with any minor children.
